name: Introduction
contents:
This is an unofficial glossary of the D&D (5th edition) rules, split into three sections - Basic, Intermediate, and Advanced. You can start by playing with the Basic rules and add more as needed. 

For sources used and how to contribute see [About](#about) section.

name: Basic Rules
contents: The core mechanic of Dungeons and Dragons is to roll a 20 sided die ("d20"), add relevant modifiers, and compare to a target number to determine success or failure.

name: Ability Score
contents:
Measures of different abilities: 

* Strength
* Dexterity
* Constitution
* Intelligence
* Wisdom
* Charisma

Max 20 for characters, 30 for monsters/divines. 

(*Intermediate*: Used to calculate [Ability Modifiers](#ability-modifier). Each has associated [Skills](#skill), e.g. Strength has Athletics.)

name: Armor Class (AC)
contents: A measure of how difficult something is to hit, 1-20+. To score a hit must roll a d20 with at least that AC. Better armor gives a higher number.

name: Class
contents:
Primary definition of what a character can do - their calling, e.g. Fighter, Druid, Ranger, etc. Affects how they see and interact with the world and other people.

(*Intermediate*: Gives special Features, like [Proficiency](#proficiency) in different weapons or armor.)

(*Advanced*: Can [Multiclass](#multiclassing) also.)

name: Combat (Basic)
contents:
Players and adversaries take turns -

* Choose a target
* Roll d20 for base Attack Roll score
* If score >= target's [Armor Class (AC)](#armor-class-(ac)), it's a hit - roll appropriate dice (based on weapon) for Damage Roll
* Rolling a natural 20 is a Critical Hit - always hits - roll for Damage twice and add. A natural 1 is a Critical Miss - always misses.

See also [Combat (Intermediate)](#combat-(intermediate)) and [Combat (Advanced)](#combat-(advanced)).

name: Experience Points (XP)
contents: Represent character's experience and determines their [Level](#level). Gain for monsters kills, significant actions, etc. See table for when to advance a [Level](#level).

name: Hit Dice (HD)
contents: These determine how many [Hit Points (HP)](#hit-points-(hp)) a character has. Different [Classes](#class) have different types of Hit Dice, e.g. d8, d10.

name: Hit Points (HP)
contents:
Represents health. At first level, Hit Points = max of [Hit Dice (HD)](#hit-dice-(hd)) + Constitution Modifier (see [Ability Modifiers](#ability-modifiers)). At subsequent levels, roll [Hit Dice (HD)](#hit-dice-(hd)) and add that with Constitution Modifier to obtain new HP, OR add half of [Hit Dice (HD)](#hit-dice-(hd)) max +1 + Constitution Modifier (avoids randomness).

(*Advanced*: When reach 0 or below HP, can be Dead or Unconscious - dead if get Massive Damage (if remaining damage >= HP max). When Unconscious must make [Saving Throws](#saving-throw) against Death (see ph197))

name: Level
contents: Character Levels are based on [Experience Points (XP)](#experience-points-(xp)) - as reach higher levels gain more abilities, skills, spells, etc.

name: Race
contents: Establishes fundamental qualities that exist throughout character's life. Determines [Hit Dice (HD)](#hit-dice-(hd)), additions to [Ability Scores](#ability-score), etc. E.g. Human, Elf, Halfling, Dragonborn, Drow.

name: Speed
contents: How far can travel in one combat Round (6 seconds) with short bursts of energy. Normal movement and travel pace is slower.

name: Ability Check
contents: Make an Ability Check to test innate talent/training to overcome a challenge. Difficulty of task is the [Difficulty Class (DC)](#difficulty-class-(dc)), 1-20. Very easy 5, Easy 10, etc.

name: Ability Modifier
contents:
Ability Modifiers range from -5 to +10. They are used more often than the raw [Ability Scores](#ability-score) on which they are based. 

Ability Modifier = floor((Ability Score - 10) / 2)

e.g. if Strength = 13 then Strength Modifier = +1

name: Action
contents:
Available actions during [Combat](#combat) include:

* Attack
* Cast Spell
* Dash - move at double speed
* Disengage - avoid [Opportunity Attacks](#opportunity-attack)
* Dodge - any attack against you has disadvantage if you can see them, and make Dexterity [Saving Throws](#saving-throw) with Advantage
* Help - aid someone and they gain Advantage on next [Ability Check](#ability-check) you're helping them with. or aid in Attack so they gain Advantage.
* Hide - make Dexterity (Stealth) [Ability Check](#ability-check) to hide
* Ready - lets you act immediately on some trigger before start of your next turn
* Search - make Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) [Ability Check](#ability-check)
* Use - if want to use more than one object in your turn
* Other - improvise!

name: Advantage / Disadvantage
contents:
Sometimes you have a better chance of succeeding at something - this is called having Advantage - e.g. an attack roll made within 5 feet of a Prone creature has Advantage. 

If some source gives you Advantage, roll twice and take the higher of the two rolls - if some source gives you Disadvantage, take the lower score.

Can use for Attack Rolls, [Ability Checks](#ability-check), [Saving Throws](#saving-throw) in various situations.

name: Background
contents: Where character came from, how came to be an adventurer, their place in the world. Each Background gives a character [Proficiency](#proficiency) in two [Skills](#skill) and one or more Tools, as well as a package of starting Equipment. Some also allow learning an additional [Language](#language).

name: Combat (Intermediate)
contents:
In addition to Basic rules,

* Add [Ability Modifier](#ability-modifier) for attack roll: Strength Modifier for melee weapon, Dexterity for ranged weapon
* Add [Proficiency Bonus](#proficiency-bonus) if [Proficient](#proficiency) with current weapon
* Determine if have [Advantage / Disadvantage](#advantage-/-disadvantage) for attack - e.g. have Advantage if they can't see you, Disadvantage if they have [Cover](#cover)
* Roll d20 twice if have Advantage or Disadvantage and take best/worst score
* For Ranged attacks - if long range or *any* enemy within 5ft have Disadvantage


* For Damage Roll, add [Ability Modifier](#ability-modifier) (same as for Attack Roll)

name: Condition
contents:
Alters capabilities in various ways.

* Blinded
* Charmed
* Deafened
* Exhaustion - see [here](#exhaustion) for table
* Frightened
* Grappled
* Incapacitated
* Invisible
* Paralyzed
* Petrified
* Poisoned
* Prone
* Restrained
* Stunned
* Unconscious

name: Damage Type
contents:
Types of Damage include 

* Acid
* Bludgeoning - e.g. from a mace
* Cold
* Fire
* Force - magic
* Lightning
* Necrotic - withers matter and soul
* Piercing - e.g. teeth
* Poison
* Psychic
* Radiant - fire/spirit
* Slashing - e.g. sword
* Thunder - sound

Can have Resistance to different Damage Types, in which case damage is halved, or Vulnerability where damage is doubled.

name: Difficulty Class (DC)
contents: The difficulty of a task from 1 to 20 - used for [Ability Checks](#ability-check), [Saving Throws](#saving-throw).

name: Exhaustion
contents:
Due to starvation etc. Effects are cumulative, e.g. at Exhaustion level 3 levels 1 and 2 apply also. Long [Rests](#rest) reduce Exhaustion level by 1. 


| Level | Effect  |
| ----------- | ----------- |
|     1 | [Disadvantage](#disadvantage) on [Ability Checks](#ability-check)         |
|     2 | [Speed](#speed) halved                       |
|     3 | [Disadvantage](#disadvantage) on Attack Rolls and Saving Throws |
|     4 | [Hit Point (HP)](#hit-point-(hp)) maximum halved               |
|     5 | [Speed](#speed) reduced to 0                         |
|     6 | [Death](#death)                                    |

name: Flaw
contents: A vice, compulsion, fear, or weakness - anything someone could exploit to bring you to ruin. What enrages you? What's the one person, concept, or event you are terrified of? What are your vices?

name: Inspiration
contents: The Dungeon Master can grant Inspiration when a player does something in character, or inspiring. The player can spend it for [Advantage](#advantage-/-disadvantage) on any future roll, or give it to another character.

name: Modifier
contents: See [Ability Modifier](#ability-modifier), e.g. Intelligence Modifier is a type of Ability Modifier.

name: Proficiency
contents: Can have Proficiency in different weapons - during [Combat](#combat) can add [Proficiency Bonus](#proficiency-bonus) to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls - or for working with certain tools, etc.

name: Proficiency Bonus
contents: Value added to rolls when player is [Proficient](#proficiency) in a relevant [Skill](#skill). Based on player's [Level](#level) - e.g. first level is +2.

name: Saving Throw
contents: Roll d20 to resist spells, traps, poison, disease etc - if >= [Difficulty Class (DC)](#difficulty-class-(dc)) of effect causing it, success.

name: Searching
contents: Use a Wisdom (Perception) [Ability Check](#ability-check) to search for hidden things. Must say specifically where searching.

name: Skill
contents:
Each [Ability Score](#ability-score) covers a set of Skills you can be [Proficient](#proficiency) in, and referred to like "Strength (Athletics)". For [Ability Checks](#ability-check) can add your [Proficiency Bonus](#proficiency-bonus) if a Skill is relevant.

| Ability      | Skills          |
|--------------|-----------------|
| Strength     | Athletics       |
| Constitution | (none)  |
| Dexterity    | Acrobatics      |
|              | Sleight of Hand |
|              | Stealth         |
| Intelligence | Arcana          |
|              | History         |
|              | Investigation   |
|              | Nature          |
|              | Religion        |
| Wisdom       | Animal Handling |
|              | Insight         |
|              | Medicine        |
|              | Perception      |
|              | Survival        |
| Charisma     | Deception       |
|              | Intimidation    |
|              | Performance     |
|              | Persuasion      |

name: Alignment
contents: Combination of Morality (Good, Evil, Neutral), and attitudes towards Society and Order (Lawful, Chaotic, or Neutral). E.g. a character or monster can be Lawful Good, Chaotic Evil, etc.

name: Bond
contents:
A connection to people, places, and events in the world. They tie you to things in your background, inspire you to heroism, drive motivations and goals. 

Whom do you care about? What is most treasured possession? Create one for your character. Can gain new bonds over adventures.

name: Bonus Action
contents: An additional [Action](#action) you take on your [Combat](#combat) turn depending on various [Class](#class) features, spells, or other abilities - e.g. a Rogue can do an additional Action due to their Cunning Action feature.

name: Carrying Capacity
contents: Amount of weight you can carry - [Speed](#speed) is affected as you carry more.

name: Combat (Advanced)
contents:
In addition to Basic and Intermediate rules,

* Establish physical positions and roll [Initiative](#initiative) to determine turn order (including adversaries) = d20 + Dexterity [Ability Modifier](#ability-modifier)
* Make sure weapon is within range - melee attacks (e.g. with sword) should be within 5ft, ranged attacks (e.g. crossbow) should be in range of weapon (normal or long range)
* If no weapon can use fists etc - on hit do Bludgeon Damage of 1+Strength [Ability Modifier](#ability-modifier)
* Can move a distance up to your [Speed](#speed) AND take one [Action](#action). Can break up movement around action. Difficult Terrain or Obstructions takes up extra foot per foot moved. 
* Can talk/gesture and interact with one object for free (e.g. drawing a sword)
* Take one [Bonus Action](#bonus-action) if allowed
* Each complete round lasts 6 seconds in the game world.

name: Cover
contents: Can [Hide](#hiding) behind things during [Combat](#combat). Half Cover gives +2 [Armor Class (AC)](#armor-class-(ac)). Three quarters gives +5, and with total cover can't be attacked except by certain spells.

name: Crafting
contents: Can Craft adventuring equipment, works of art. Must be [Proficient](#proficiency) with Tools related to object and have access to materials. For each day spent crafting can make market value up to 5gp, with cost of half that - e.g. plate armor (1500gp) takes 300 days to craft alone, though others can help out to reduce time.

name: Downtime
contents: Between adventures - must spend money each day for Lifestyle Expenses. Can Can [Craft](#craft) items, work at a [Profession](#profession) to earn money, [Rest](#rest) to recover from poisons, do [Research](#research) to find information, [Train](#train) to learn new [Language](#language) or tool [Skill](#skill).

name: Feat
contents: Represents a talent or area of expertise - embodies training, experience, and abilities. Can choose to add a Feat instead of increasing [Ability Scores](#ability-score) when advancing a [Level](#level). Can gain [Advantage](#advantage-/-disadvantage), [Proficiency](#proficiency) in different [Skills](#skill), etc. E.g. Alert, Dual Wielder, Healer, Mage Slayer.

name: Food / Water
contents: Need one pound food and one gallon water/day, two gallons if hot. Below this suffer increasing levels of [Exhaustion](#exhaustion) (see table in PH).

name: Hiding
contents: Make a Dexterity (Stealth) [Ability Check](#ability-check) when attempting to hide from enemies etc.

name: Ideal
contents: Something that drives your character. What principals will you never betray? Why would you make sacrifices? What guides your goals and ambitions? What single thing do you strive for? [Backgrounds](#background) give some suggestions.

name: Initiative
contents: Determines order of turns taken in [Combat (Advanced)](#combat-(advanced)).

name: Language
contents: Default language is given by [Race](#race), can learn others - see [Training](#training).

name: Multiclassing
contents: Can gain [Levels](#levels) in multiple [Classes](#class) - choose which to advance in when gain a Level. Your character Level is the sum of your different Levels.

name: Passive Checks
contents: For hiding, exploration - to check for traps, secrets, etc. No die roll - for score just use 10 + all modifiers relevant to check, with +5 if have [Advantage](#advantage), -5 if [Disadvantage](#disadvantage).

name: Personality Trait
contents: Something interesting and fun about a character - their likes, past accomplishments, what they dislike or fear, self-attitude, mannerisms, pet peeves, quotes, etc. Each character gets two. Look at highest and lowest [Ability Scores](#ability-score) for some ideas - [Backgrounds](#background) also give some suggestions.

name: Rest
contents:
Short Rests need at least an hour. Can roll [Hit Dice (HD)](#hit-dice-(hd)) x your Level - add that plus your Constitution Modifier to your [Hit Points (HP)](#hit-points-(hp)). 

Long Rests need at least 8 hours, and restore all [Hit Points (HP)](#hit-points-(hp)).

Optionally, both require use of one Healer's Kit first. 

You can use [Downtime](#downtime) between adventures to recover from debilitating Injury, Disease, or Poison. After 3 days of Downtime can make [Difficulty Class (DC)](#difficulty-class-(dc)) 15 Constitution [Saving Throw](#saving-throw) - on success gain Advantage on [Saving Throws](#saving-throw) against one Disease or Poison.

name: Subrace
contents: Some [Races](#race) have Subraces available, e.g. Hill Dwarfs vs Mountain Dwarfs.

name: Training
contents: Can train to learn new [Language](#language), tool [Skill](#skill) [Proficiency](#proficiency) - must find instructor. Training lasts 250 days and costs 1gp per day.

name: Travel
contents: Can travel at normal, fast, or slow pace (table ph182). Can only do half speed in Difficult Terrain.

name: About
contents:
Sources used are the [Player's Handbook 5th Edition](https://www.amazon.com/Players-Handbook-Dungeons-Dragons-Wizards/dp/0786965606/ref=sr_1_15), with references to page numbers in the book given as e.g. "ph152" for page 152 - and the [System Reference Document (SRD) rules online](https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/basic-rules).
